info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:19PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Mineral and southwestern Sanders Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 218 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lookout Pass to De Borgia. Movement is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... Haugan, De Borgia, Lookout Pass, Saltese, East Portal and Taft. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 0 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
